jx.jx_en_mean: To interrupt the speech of others, especially with an unwanted opinion.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 插话：尤指表达无用的看法而打断别人的说话

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (in the senses 'cymbal' and 'ring out'): probably from Old English cimbal (see cymbal), later interpreted as chime bell
late Middle English: probably from an Old English word related to Dutch kim and German Kimme. Compare with chine

entry.def: When a bell or a clock chimes, it makes ringing sounds.

example.ex: He heard the front doorbell chime.
...as the Guildhall clock chimed three o'clock.
example.tran: 市政厅的大钟敲响3点的时候

entry.def: A chime is a ringing sound made by a bell, especially when it is part of a clock.

example.ex: At that moment a chime sounded from the front of the house...
example.tran: 就在那时，房前传来一声铃。

example.ex: The ceremony started as the chimes of midnight struck.
example.tran: 子夜钟声响起的时候，仪式开始了。

entry.def: Chimes are a set of small objects which make a ringing sound when they are blown by the wind.

example.ex: ...the haunting sound of the wind chimes.

means.word_mean: 1. a percussion instrument consisting of vertical metal tubes of different lengths that are struck with a hammer

sentences.en: The chime of the clock woke him up.
She kept chiming in with her own opinions.
sentences.cn: 她一直在插嘴,表明自己的意见。

sentences.en: He kept chiming in with his own opinions.
sentences.cn: 他不断插话发表自己的意见。

sentences.en: His policies chimed in with the national mood at the time.
sentences.cn: 他的政策与当时国民的心态相吻合。
